Package com.cafean.jobstream.tracker

Class TrackerModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.jobstream.tracker.TrackerModule
  • public abstract class TrackerModule
extends java.lang.Object
    A TrackerModule encapsulates all access to a Tracking Server at runtime.

    Implementations this interface are used by the Stream Manager to update the selected tracking server as tasks are queued, started, finished, etc. It is used by Job Status to communicate with the tracking server to display the status and contents of streams, and tasks during and after they are run. And finally, it is used by the ModelEditor during the submission of a complete job stream.

    The "TrackerModule" manifest attribute is used to determine which JAR files in the [SNAP Install]/siteconfig/ folder contain tracker module implementations. This attribute should appear in a separate "section"/"entry" of the manifest with a name that matches the name of the TrackerModule implementation. This name will be used to determine which tracker module implementation to load.

    Tracker modules will be instantiated specifically to communicate with the tracking server for a particular platform. Multiple platforms using the same tracking server location initialize and use separate instances of the same TrackerModule.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new TrackerModule instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrackerModule

        public TrackerModule()
        Creates a new TrackerModule instance.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize​(PlatformProperties properties,
                          StreamLogger logger)
        Initializes this tracker module for use in accessing the given job tracking database server to support the given platform.

        Note: The base implementation always returns true.

        Parameters:
        properties - a PlatformProperties describing the platform
        logger - the StreamLogger that all messages should be sent to
        Returns:
        true for success; false for failure. This base implementation always returns true.

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize​(PlatformDefinition platform,
                          StreamLogger logger)
        Initializes this tracker module for use in accessing the given job tracking database server to support the given platform.

        Note: Only one of the initialize methods will be called for a given tracker module instance. The method will be selected based on the application initializing the module.

        Parameters:
        platform - a PlatformDefinition describing the platform
        logger - the StreamLogger that all messages should be sent to
        Returns:
        true for success; false for failure. This base implementation always returns true.

      • setParentWindow

        public void setParentWindow​(java.awt.Window parentWindow)
        Gets the Window that this tracker module should use when displaying UI elements (such as login dialogs) to the user. A parent window is only provided by client applications and as such can be used to determine whether a user interface is available.

        Note: No GUI elements should be displayed unless this parent window has been provided.

        Parameters:
        parentWindow - the Window that should be used as the parent window for tracker module specific user interface elements.

      • getParentWindow

        public java.awt.Window getParentWindow()
        Sets the Window that this tracker module should use when displaying UI elements (such as login dialogs) to the user. A parent window is only provided by client applications and as such can be used to determine whether a user interface is available.

        Note: No GUI elements should be displayed unless this parent window has been provided.

        Returns:
        parentWindow the Window that is being used as the parent window for tracker module specific user interface elements.

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Retrieves the name (a.k.a. "type name") of this tracker module. This name must be unique amongst the installed TrackerModule implementations as it is used by TrackerDefinitions to identify the tracker module at runtime.

      • getStreams

        public abstract JobStreamRec[] getStreams​(java.lang.String userid)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves a JobStreamRec describing each of the streams belonging to the given user. If no streams are found the returned array will be zero-length. It is assumed that the given user id will normally be the user id retrieved by calling System.getProperty("user.name").
        Parameters:
        userid - a String containing the userid of the current user
        Returns:
        a JobStreamRec[] containing records describing each of the streams owned by the given user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • getStreams

        public abstract JobStreamRec[] getStreams​(java.lang.String userid,
                                          java.util.Date completedBy)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves a JobStreamRec describing each of the streams belonging to the given user with a completed date on or after the given date (or still running). If no streams are found, the returned array will be zero-length. It is assumed that the given user id will normally be the user id retrieved by calling System.getProperty("user.name"). Pass null for the date to retrieve all streams, regardless of completed time.
        Parameters:
        userid - a String containing the userid of the current user
        completedBy -
        Returns:
        a JobStreamRec[] containing records describing each of the streams owned by the given user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • getStreams

        public JobStreamRec[] getStreams​(java.lang.String userid,
                                 java.lang.String platform_id,
                                 java.util.Date completedBy)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves a JobStreamRec describing each of the streams belonging to the given user with a completed date on or after the given date (or still running). If no streams are found, the returned array will be zero-length. It is assumed that the given user id will normally be the user id retrieved by calling System.getProperty("user.name").

        Pass null for the date to retrieve all streams, regardless of completed time.

        Note: The default implementation of this method calls getStreams(String,Date) then returns only those streams that are from the given platform. This method should be overridden to instead retrieve only those streams that match the platform.

        Parameters:
        userid - a String containing the userid of the current user
        platform_id - a String containing the ID of the platform for which stream should be retrieved or null for all streams regardless of platform.
        completedBy - a Date indicating the time after which the returned streams must have completed.
        Returns:
        a JobStreamRec[] containing records describing each of the streams owned by the given user and submitted to the given platform.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request
        Since:
        May 2012

      • getStream

        public abstract JobStreamRec getStream​(long dbid)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves a JobStreamRec describing the stream with the given DB_ID.
        Parameters:
        dbid - the DB_ID of the requested job stream.
        Returns:
        a JobStreamRec describing the requested Stream or null if not found
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • addStream

        public abstract long addStream​(JobStreamRec stream)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds the given stream record to the tracking server with the current status indicating that is has been (or will shortly be) submitted to the batch queuing system.
        Parameters:
        stream - a JobStreamRec describing the newly submitted stream.
        Returns:
        the DBID of the newly created STREAMS row.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • removeStream

        public abstract void removeStream​(long dbid)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Removes the stream with the given DB_ID from the tracker server. Note that removing a stream will also remove the tasks that reference it, and in turn, the files that reference those tasks.
        Parameters:
        dbid - the DB_ID of the stream to remove.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • getStreamProperties

        public JobStreamPropertyRec[] getStreamProperties​(long streamDbid)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                  java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns a JobStreamPropertyRec describing each of the stream properties that have been overridden for the given stream. An empty array indicates that no properties have been overridden.
        Parameters:
        streamDbid - the DB_ID of the job stream.
        Returns:
        a JobStreamPropertyRec[] containing the overridden properties for the stream.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this TrackerModule does not support overriding stream properties.

      • addStreamLog

        public void addStreamLog​(long streamDbid,
                         java.lang.String message)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Adds the given log message to the SNAP.LOG table for the given stream. Note that the new log message will use the current time as its created_on time rather than using any timestamp available in the given message.
        Parameters:
        streamDbid - the DBID of the job stream
        message - a String containing the log message
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • getStreamLog

        public LogRec[] getStreamLog​(long streamDbid)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns a LogRec describing each of the log messages stored for the given stream.
        Parameters:
        streamDbid - the DB_ID of the job stream
        Returns:
        a LogRec[] containing the log messages
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this TrackerModule does not support log retrieval.

      • getStreamLog

                           long logDbid)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                           java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns a LogRec describing the requested log message.
        Parameters:
        streamDbid - the DB_ID of the job stream
        logDbid - he DB_ID of the log message
        Returns:
        a LogRec containing the log message
        Throws:

        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this TrackerModule does not support log retrieval.

      • setStreamProperty

        public void setStreamProperty​(long streamDbid,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String value)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException,
                              java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the value of the stream property with the given name to the given value.
        Parameters:
        streamDbid - the DB_ID of the job stream.
        name - a String containing the name of the property to set
        value - a String containing the value to set for the property
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this TrackerModule does not support overriding stream properties.

      • getTasks

        public abstract TaskRec[] getTasks​(long streamDbid)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves a TaskRec describing each of the tasks belonging to the stream with the given DB_ID. If the stream is not found or contains no tasks the returned array will be zero-length.
        Parameters:
        streamDbid - the DB_ID of the parent job stream
        Returns:
        a TaskRec[] containing records describing each of the tasks in the requested Stream
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • getTasks

        public abstract TaskRec[] getTasks​(long streamDbid,
                                   long[] taskDbid)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieves the TaskRec[] containing the tasks with the given DB_IDs.
        Returns:
        a TaskRec[] describing the requested tasks with nulls for those not found
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • addTasks

        public abstract long[] addTasks​(long streamDbid,
                                TaskRec[] tasks)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds the given task records to the tracking server with the given stream DB_ID and the current status indicating that they have been (or will shortly be) submitted to the batch queuing system.
        Parameters:
        streamDbid - the DB_ID of the parent job stream
        tasks - a TaskRec[] containing the tasks to be added
        Returns:
        a long[] containing the DBIDs of the newly created TASKS rows.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

        Parameters:
        taskDbid - the DB_ID of the task to remove.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

        Returns:

      • getTaskKeywords

        public abstract TaskKeywordRec[] getTaskKeywords​(long taskDbid)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException

        Returns:
        a TaskKeywordRec[] containing records describing each of the keywords in the requested task

      • setFileStorageLocation

        public abstract void setFileStorageLocation​(long fileDbid,
                                            java.lang.String location)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Replaces the current storage location of the file with the given DB_ID. This can be used to indicate that the given file has been moved to a different location.
        Parameters:
        fileDbid - the DB_ID of the file that has been moved
        location - a String containing the new location of the file
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • streamChanged

        public abstract void streamChanged​(java.util.List<? extends TrackerEvent> list)
        Notifies the tracking server of the job stream status changes described by the given list of change events. Errors that occur during the processing of these events will be reported to the stream logger provided to the tracker module in initializeImpl(String, String, StreamLogger).
        Parameters:
        list - a List of tracker events that describe changes to a job stream, its status, or its tasks.

      • registerListener

        public abstract void registerListener​(int port,
                                      int trackingServerID)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Registers the given port, local host name, and current user as a listener for notifications of changes to streams and tasks owned by the current user.
        Parameters:
        port - the port on which this application is listening for notifications
        trackingServerID - a client-supplied integer ID that will be included in each notification. This allows the listening interface to determine which tracking server the notification is from.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request
        See Also:
        getHostName()

      • unregisterListener

        public abstract void unregisterListener​(int port,
                                        int trackingServerID)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Removes the given port and local host name from the list of registered listeners on the tracking server.
        Parameters:
        port - the port on which this application is listening for notifications
        trackingServerID - a client-supplied integer ID that will be included in each notification. This allows the listening interface to determine which tracking server the notification is from.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - to indicate errors during the request

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes of any currently active resources held by this module. Note that this method may not be called for modules that are not currently being used.

      • getPlatformPath

        public java.lang.String getPlatformPath()
        returns the platform path of the platform associated with the tracker module

        public java.lang.String getServerLocation()
        returns the connection location that will be used to connect to the tracking database server

      • requestShutdown

        public static void requestShutdown()
        Indicates to all platform module implementations that the currently executing application has begun its shutdown process.
        See Also:
